name: Ceres
description: Ceres is the largest object in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. It has a unique hydrogeological structure and may contain a subsurface ocean, making it a subject of astrobiological interest.

name: Vesta
description: Vesta is one of the largest asteroids in the asteroid belt. It has a differentiated interior and a bright surface with massive impact craters, offering clues about early solar system history.

name: Pallas
description: Pallas is a large, highly inclined asteroid in the asteroid belt. Its irregular shape and unique orbit have made it a target for studies of early solar system dynamics.

name: Halley
description: Halley's Comet is one of the most famous short-period comets, visible from Earth every 76 years. Its visits have been documented for millennia, inspiring both science and mythology.

name: Encke
description: Comet Encke has the shortest known orbital period of any known comet, completing a trip around the Sun every 3.3 years. Its frequent visits make it a valuable target for cometary studies.

name: Eros
description: Eros is a near-Earth asteroid and the first asteroid orbited by a spacecraft (NEAR Shoemaker). It is elongated in shape and has a surface covered with boulders and craters.

name: Itokawa
description: Itokawa is a small near-Earth asteroid explored by the Japanese Hayabusa mission. It is a rubble-pile asteroid with a highly irregular shape and surface boulders.

name: Tempel 1
description: Comet Tempel 1 was visited by NASA's Deep Impact mission, which revealed its layered surface and ejected material, providing insight into cometary composition and evolution.

name: Bennu
description: Bennu is a near-Earth asteroid visited by NASA's OSIRIS-REx mission. Its surface contains hydrated minerals, and it is considered a potentially hazardous asteroid due to its orbit.

name: Borrelly
description: Comet Borrelly was visited by NASA's Deep Space 1 spacecraft. Its elongated nucleus and active jets provided detailed insights into comet morphology and outgassing behavior.

name: Gaspra
description: Gaspra is a small asteroid in the inner asteroid belt and was the first asteroid visited by a spacecraft (Galileo in 1991). It has a heavily cratered surface with ridges and grooves.

name: Ida
description: Ida is notable for its tiny moon, Dactyl, making it the first asteroid discovered to have a natural satellite. Explored by Galileo in 1993, its surface is marked with numerous craters.

name: Toutatis
description: Toutatis is a near-Earth asteroid with a highly irregular shape and tumbling rotation. Its orbit occasionally brings it close to Earth, making it a subject of planetary defense studies.

name: Wild 2
description: Comet Wild 2 was visited by NASA's Stardust mission in 2004, which returned samples of cometary dust to Earth. Its surface shows large boulders and active jets.

name: Swift-Tuttle
description: Comet Swift-Tuttle is the parent body of the Perseid meteor shower. Its large size and periodic close approaches to Earth make it a significant object in planetary defense studies.

name: Ryugu
description: Ryugu is a near-Earth asteroid visited by JAXA's Hayabusa2 mission. Its diamond shape and rubble-pile structure provide insights into the formation and evolution of primitive asteroids.

name: Churyumov-Gerasimenko
description: Comet 67P was visited by ESA's Rosetta mission. Its bilobed shape and complex surface features, including cliffs and pits, offer valuable information about comet formation.

name: Hygiea
description: Hygiea is the fourth-largest asteroid in the asteroid belt and a candidate dwarf planet. Its dark surface and nearly spherical shape suggest it may have been shaped by past collisions.

name: Hartley 2
description: Comet Hartley 2 was visited by NASA's EPOXI mission. Its elongated nucleus exhibits rapid rotation and active jets, revealing fresh icy material and complex cometary activity.

name: Florence
description: Florence is a near-Earth asteroid and the largest known potentially hazardous asteroid that has made close approaches to Earth. Its radar imaging revealed a bilobed shape.

name: Sierra Nevada
description: Sierra Nevada is a near-Earth asteroid with a relatively small size. Its orbit brings it close to Earth, making it an object of interest for observation and tracking.

name: Deimos
description: Deimos is the smaller of Marsâ€™ two moons and is asteroid-like in composition. It has a heavily cratered surface and may be a captured asteroid from the outer asteroid belt.

name: Ikeya-Seki
description: Ikeya-Seki is a bright sungrazing comet known for its close approach to the Sun in 1965. It produced an impressive display and is a member of the Kreutz comet family.

name: Mathilde
description: Mathilde is a dark, carbon-rich asteroid visited by the NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft. Its very low density suggests it is a rubble-pile asteroid with high porosity.

name: Wild 2
description: Wild 2 was sampled by NASA's Stardust mission. It contains both volatile ices and organic compounds, providing clues about the early solar system.

name: Quaoar
description: Quaoar is a large trans-Neptunian object in the Kuiper belt. Its discovery has expanded our knowledge of distant icy bodies beyond Neptune.

name: Neujmin 1
description: Comet Neujmin 1 is a short-period comet with a moderate eccentric orbit. It has been regularly observed and tracked to understand cometary activity.

name: Baptistina
description: Baptistina is an asteroid in the main belt, thought to be the parent body of the Baptistina family. It may have played a role in historical impact events on Earth.

name: Hartley
description: Comet Hartley was visited by NASA's EPOXI mission, showing active jets and a rapidly rotating elongated nucleus, providing detailed information on comet dynamics.

name: Psyche
description: Psyche is a unique metallic asteroid thought to be the exposed core of a protoplanet. NASA's Psyche mission aims to explore it, offering insights into planetary formation processes.

name: Vulcano
description: Vulcano is a near-Sun asteroid with a very short orbital period. Its extreme proximity to the Sun makes it difficult to observe and of interest for solar system dynamics studies.

name: Tempel-Tuttle
description: Comet Tempel-Tuttle is the parent comet of the Leonid meteor shower. Its periodic returns create spectacular meteor storms when Earth passes through its debris.

name: Pallas
description: Pallas is a large asteroid with a highly inclined orbit in the main belt. Its irregular shape and surface features make it unique among large asteroids.

name: Shoemaker-Levy 9
description: Comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 famously collided with Jupiter in 1994, providing unprecedented data on planetary impacts and cometary composition.

name: Davida
description: Davida is one of the largest asteroids in the main belt. Its slightly elongated shape and numerous craters make it an interesting target for studying asteroid geology.

name: Icarus
description: Icarus is a near-Earth asteroid with a highly eccentric orbit, approaching closer to the Sun than Mercury. It is classified as a potentially hazardous asteroid.

name: Chiron
description: Chiron is a centaur object with both asteroid- and comet-like properties. It orbits between Saturn and Uranus and occasionally exhibits cometary activity.

name: Florence
description: Florence is a near-Earth asteroid known for its close approaches. Radar imaging revealed a bilobed structure and a relatively large size for a near-Earth object.

name: Borrelly
description: Comet Borrelly was visited by Deep Space 1, revealing an elongated nucleus and active jets. Its surface features offer insights into cometary structure and composition.

name: Interamnia
description: Interamnia is one of the largest asteroids in the main belt. Its nearly spherical shape and dark surface make it a notable object for studying asteroid composition and evolution.

name: Europa
description: Europa is a large main-belt asteroid with a dark, primitive surface. Its relatively low density suggests a mixture of rock and ice.

name: Tempel 2
description: Comet Tempel 2 is a periodic comet in the inner solar system. It has been extensively observed over multiple returns, providing valuable data on cometary evolution.

name: Hektor
description: Hektor is the largest Trojan asteroid and has an elongated shape. It may have a small satellite and provides clues about the Jupiter Trojan population.

name: Neowise
description: Comet NEOWISE became widely visible in 2020. Its bright coma and tail made it a spectacular sight, while observations provided data on cometary composition and activity.

name: Hygiea
description: Hygiea is a large, dark asteroid and candidate dwarf planet in the outer asteroid belt. Its nearly spherical shape is unique among large asteroids.

name: Shoemaker
description: Comet Shoemaker was studied for its unique orbit and potential interaction with Jupiter, contributing to understanding of cometary dynamics in the solar system.

name: Egeria
description: Egeria is a large main-belt asteroid with a dark, primitive surface. It is notable for its spectral properties that indicate hydrated minerals.

name: Lovejoy
description: Comet Lovejoy gained attention for surviving a close approach to the Sun. Its bright tail and active jets provide insight into cometary behavior under extreme solar heating.

name: Davida
description: Davida is a large main-belt asteroid with an irregular shape and numerous craters, providing valuable information on asteroid composition and collisional history.

name: Siding Spring
description: Comet Siding Spring made a close approach to Mars in 2014, allowing orbiters and rovers to study its dust tail and gas emissions, enhancing our understanding of comet interactions with planets.

name: Apophis
description: Apophis is a near-Earth asteroid known for its initially predicted close approaches to Earth in 2029 and 2036. Current observations rule out a collision, but it remains a high-interest object for planetary defense.

name: Golevka
description: Golevka is a near-Earth asteroid with a highly elongated shape. Radar observations revealed its unusual three-lobed structure, making it important for studies of asteroid shapes and dynamics.

name: Churyumov-Gerasimenko
description: Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko was the target of ESA's Rosetta mission, which revealed its bilobed shape, cliffs, pits, and rich organic chemistry, providing unparalleled insights into comet formation.

name: Didymos
description: Didymos is a binary near-Earth asteroid system. NASA's DART mission tested planetary defense by impacting its smaller moon, demonstrating asteroid deflection technology.

name: Arrokoth
description: Arrokoth is a Kuiper Belt object visited by NASA's New Horizons mission. Its contact binary shape provides clues about early solar system planetesimal formation.

name: Comet ISON
description: Comet ISON was a sungrazing comet that disintegrated during its close approach to the Sun in 2013. Its brightness and fragmentation provided critical insights into cometary behavior under extreme solar conditions.

name: Eros
description: Eros is a near-Earth asteroid and the first asteroid orbited by a spacecraft (NEAR Shoemaker). Its elongated shape and boulder-covered surface make it a rich target for study.

name: Comet McNaught
description: Comet McNaught, also known as the Great Comet of 2007, was spectacularly bright and visible even during daytime. Its activity provided excellent opportunities for studying comet tails and jets.

name: Toutatis
description: Toutatis is a near-Earth asteroid with a tumbling, irregular rotation. Its complex orbit and shape have made it a focus for radar and observational studies.

name: Comet Hyakutake
description: Comet Hyakutake made a close approach to Earth in 1996, offering spectacular views. Its large ion tail and bright coma provided valuable data on cometary composition and plasma interactions.
